name: TechFest 2025
description: Annual technology festival showcasing innovative projects, coding competitions, and tech talks by industry experts. Participants can join workshops, hackathons, and enjoy networking opportunities with professionals and fellow students.

name: AI & Machine Learning Workshop
description: This workshop provides practical training in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning using tools like Python, TensorFlow, and PyTorch. Participants will build models for text classification, image recognition, and predictive analytics. Industry experts will deliver keynote talks and share insights on real-world AI applications. The workshop is designed for students eager to strengthen their portfolios and research skills in AI.

name: Physics Research Symposium
description: The Physics Research Symposium 2025 brings together faculty, researchers, and students to present their latest findings in quantum mechanics, optics, and astrophysics. The event includes keynote speeches from invited professors and guest scientists from international institutions. Attendees will have the opportunity to explore interdisciplinary collaborations. The symposium encourages students to pursue advanced research projects and engage in critical scientific discussions.

name: Astronomy Observation Night
description: Astronomy Night offers students and faculty a chance to explore the night sky through high-powered telescopes. Guided by astronomy experts, participants will learn to identify constellations, planets, and other celestial objects. The event will also include short lectures on astronomical phenomena and a documentary screening. It’s a unique opportunity for students to combine science with cultural appreciation of the cosmos.

name: Art & Culture Expo
description: The Art & Culture Expo is an annual celebration of creativity where students display their talents in painting, sculpture, music, and theater. Visitors can experience live performances, interactive art installations, and workshops led by faculty and guest artists. The event aims to foster cultural exchange and highlight the diverse artistic voices within the university. It is open to both students and the public community.

name: Annual Painting Competition
description: The Annual Painting Competition gathers young artists from different universities to showcase their creativity. This year’s theme, 'Green Future,' encourages participants to express their vision of sustainability and environmental awareness. Judges include renowned painters and art professors who will provide professional critiques. Winning entries will be displayed in the university gallery and featured in an art magazine.

name: Business Summit 2025
description: Business Summit 2025 brings together corporate leaders, entrepreneurs, and students to discuss global economic challenges and future business models. Sessions include keynote addresses on finance, marketing, and leadership. The event also features startup pitching rounds, providing students an opportunity to present their ideas. Networking sessions are organized to connect aspiring managers with industry professionals.

name: Marketing Fair
description: The Marketing Fair is an interactive event where students present creative marketing campaigns and innovative branding strategies. Booths will showcase promotional concepts, social media campaigns, and advertising prototypes. Industry professionals will be invited to evaluate the presentations and provide feedback. The fair is designed to bridge the gap between classroom knowledge and real-world marketing practices.

name: Inter-Department Football Final
description: The Inter-Department Football Final is the most anticipated sports event of the year. The top two departmental teams will battle for the championship trophy in front of a large crowd. Cheerleaders, live commentary, and a halftime show will add excitement to the game. Fans are encouraged to wear their department colors and show their support.

name: Annual Sports Day
description: The Annual Sports Day is a full-day athletic meet featuring track races, long jump, relay competitions, and team games. Students from different departments will compete in both individual and group events. The day fosters sportsmanship, teamwork, and physical fitness. Medals and trophies will be awarded to outstanding performers.

name: Green Chemistry Seminar
description: The Green Chemistry Seminar focuses on eco-friendly chemical processes and sustainable lab practices. Experts will present research on biodegradable materials, renewable energy, and pollution control. Students will participate in live demonstrations and panel discussions. The seminar aims to raise awareness about the role of chemistry in building a sustainable future.

name: Chemistry Fair
description: The Chemistry Fair provides a platform for students to demonstrate exciting experiments and research projects. Stalls will showcase interactive models, chemical reactions, and posters on various chemistry topics. Visitors will have the chance to engage in safe, hands-on experiments. The fair encourages scientific curiosity and celebrates the beauty of chemistry.

name: Medical Innovations Conference
description: The Medical Innovations Conference brings together doctors, researchers, and medical students to discuss the latest advancements in healthcare. Topics include biotechnology, digital health, and robotic surgery. Renowned doctors will deliver keynote speeches and share case studies. The conference serves as a platform to inspire innovation and improve healthcare delivery.

name: Free Health Checkup Camp
description: The Free Health Checkup Camp is a community outreach program organized by medical students and faculty. The camp offers general checkups, blood tests, and basic consultations at no cost. Volunteers will provide health awareness sessions on nutrition, hygiene, and preventive care. The event reflects the university’s commitment to social responsibility and public health.

name: Legal Awareness Seminar
description: The Legal Awareness Seminar focuses on recent changes in civil and criminal law. Guest speakers from the High Court and practicing lawyers will share their expertise. Students will gain insights into legal rights, reforms, and case precedents. The seminar aims to empower students with legal knowledge and encourage careers in the justice system.

name: Moot Court Competition
description: The Moot Court Competition is a simulated courtroom experience where students argue legal cases. Teams will present written submissions and oral arguments before a panel of judges. The competition sharpens advocacy, research, and analytical skills. It is one of the most prestigious events for law students, offering recognition and career opportunities.

name: Poetry Recitation Contest
description: The Poetry Recitation Contest invites literature enthusiasts to showcase their talent in spoken word and creative expression. Participants will recite poems from classic and contemporary writers or perform their original works. The event celebrates the beauty of language and the power of words. Judges will evaluate based on expression, clarity, and creativity.

name: Literature Fest
description: The Literature Fest is a multi-day celebration dedicated to books, writers, and the art of storytelling. Events include author talks, panel discussions, and live book readings. Students will stage theatrical adaptations of famous novels and showcase creative writing. The fest creates an immersive experience for anyone passionate about literature.

name: Environmental Summit
description: The Environmental Summit brings together students, researchers, and policymakers to discuss urgent issues like climate change and biodiversity loss. Sessions will cover renewable energy, sustainable agriculture, and green technology. The summit also features poster presentations and student-led workshops. The goal is to inspire actionable steps toward a more sustainable future.

name: Tree Plantation Drive
description: The Tree Plantation Drive is a campus-wide green initiative led by environmental science students. Volunteers will plant hundreds of trees around the university to promote ecological balance. The event will also include awareness sessions on the importance of reforestation and biodiversity conservation. It aims to engage students in meaningful sustainability practices.
